Title: Where’s the fun in accessibility?
Description: UX is not only about the way it works, but about delight, whimsy, wit, and beauty. But when it comes to accessibility, we tend to take the term literally. Why?

Title: How quickly can you convert floats to doubles (and back)?
Description: Many programming languages have two binary floating-point types: float (32-bit) and double (64-bit). It reflects the fact that most general-purpose processors supports both data types natively. Often we need to convert between the two types. Both ARM and x64 processors can do in one inexpensive instructions. For example, ARM systems may use the fcvt instruction. … Continue reading How quickly can you convert floats to doubles (and back)?

Title: What if your website had business hours? — Bobbie Chen
Description:
In "Being on-call sucks", I wrote about how having an on-call person or rotation is required for any software service running 24/7.
While reviewing the draft, my friend Michael L. pointed out that while most websites are up all the time, some are not - for example, B&H Photo doesn't accept orders on Saturdays for religious reasons.
So what if our software business had limited hours instead, like a physical-world store?

Title: The best investment
Description: Advice to developers entering the industry: the best investment is in yourself.

Title: How do we work together?
Description:
When she was a teacher, on the first day of each class, Lauren, my wife, would start the year with a simple activity.
She sat her first or second greaters down around a big sheet of paper, hung on the wall.
